quote: If you can't learn to do it well, learn to enjoy doing it badly.
author: Brilliant, Ashleigh

quote: The ability to get to the verge without getting into the war is the necessary art.... If you try to run away from it, if you are scared to go to the brink, you are lost.
author: Dulles, John Foster

quote: People are always ready to admit a man's ability after he gets there.
author: Edwards, Bob

quote: Our chief want in life is somebody who shall make us do what we can.
author: Emerson, Ralph Waldo

quote: The moment we indulge our affections, the earth is metamorphosed, there is no winter and no night; all tragedies, allennuis,vanish, - all duties even.
author: Emerson, Ralph Waldo

quote: If they try to rush me, I always say, I've only got one other speed and it's slower.
author: Ford, Glenn

quote: It is all one to me if a man comes from Sing Sing or Harvard. We hire a man, not his history.
author: Ford, Henry

quote: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
author: Frost, Robert

quote: 'Tis skill not strength that governs a ship.
author: Fuller, Thomas

quote: The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
author: Gibbon, Edward

quote: Reason and the ability to use it are two separate skills.
author: Grillparzer, Franz

quote: The carpenter is not the best who makesmore chips than all the rest.
author: Guiterman, Arthur

quote: Caresses, expressions of one sort or another, are necessary to the life of the affections as leaves are to the life of a tree.  If they are wholly restrained, love will die at the roo
author: Hawthorne, Nathaniel

quote: Skill and confidence are an unconquered ar
author: Herbert, George

quote: A man dies still if he has done nothing, as one who has done much.
author: Homer

quote: Natural abilities are like natural plants, that need pruning by study; and studies themselves do give forth directions too much at large, except they be bounded in by experience.
author: Bacon, Francis

quote: Affection, like melancholy, magnifiestrifles; but the magnifying of the one is like looking through a telescope at heavenly objects; that of the other, like enlarging monsters with a microscop
author: Hunt, Leigh

quote: A woman's life is a history of the affections.
author: Irving, Washington

quote: When people find a man of the most distinguished abilities as a writer their inferior while he is with them, it must behighly gratifying to them.
author: Johnson, Samuel

quote: The extraordinary ability of a woman to forget is not the same as the talent of a lady not to be able to remember.
author: Kraus, Karl

quote: Ability wins us the esteem of the true men; luck that of the people.
author: La Rochefoucauld, Fran?ois

quote: There is great ability in knowing how to conveal one's ability.
author: La Rochefoucauld, Fran?ois

quote: The affections are like lightning: you cannot tell where they will strike till they have fallen.
author: Lacordaire, Jean Baptiste

quote: Talk not of wasted affection; affection never was wasted.
author: Longfellow, Henry Wadsworth

quote: From each according to his abilities, to each according to his needs.
author: Marx, Karl

quote: Ability hits the mark where presumption overshoots and diffidence falls short.
author: Newman, John Henry

quote: Competence, like truth, beauty and contact lenses, is in the eye of the beholder.
author: Peter, Laurence J.

quote: I never met a man I didn't like.
author: Rogers, Will

quote: All my life affection has been showered upon me, and every forward step I have made has been taken in spite of it.
author: Shaw, George Bernard

quote: A slight touch of friendly malice and amusement towards those we love keeps our affections for them from turning flat.
author: Smith, Logan P.

quote: Ability is commonly found to consist mainly in a high degree of solemnity.
author: Bierce, Ambrose

quote: Ability is the art of getting credit for all the home runs somebody else hits.
author: Stengel, Casey

quote: No one knows what he can do until hetries.
author: Syrus, Publilius

quote: Ability lies in the mind and the heart.  To tell your mind to limit your abilities a
author: Unknown

quote: Ability is of little account without opportunity.
author: Bonaparte, Napoleon

quote: Men take only their needs into consideration never their abilities.
author: Bonaparte, Napoleon
